page.title: 04ROUGH CLOSE SCOUT CAMP
page.content: Rough Close is the camp site of the City of Coventry Scout County. It is 43 acres-15 acres of open land, the rest woodland. The cub field has a small totem pole in the centre. The land was given to scouting by a wealthy Canadian businessman about 20 to 30 years ago. It is used for camping by scouts, cubs and guides from all over the country. It is also used for leader training, county and district events and by different groups for outdoor activities. Our pack goes in the summer for putting up tents, fire-lighting and cooking. The scouts own open air chapel is on site holding services at 11.30a.m. and 12 noon on Sundays. As well as cabins, first aid hut, washing facilities, bridging pool and camp fire circle there is a providore which sells sweets, drinks,food and souvenirs.
